knimeNode.name: Silhouette Coefficient
knimeNode.shortDescription: This is Silhouette (clustering) node provided by KNIME.com.

fullDescription.intro: Silhouette refers to a method of interpretation and validation of consistency within clusters of data. The technique provides a succinct numerical representation of how well each object lies within its cluster. The silhouette value is a measure of how similar an object is to its own cluster (cohesion) compared to other clusters (separation). The silhouette ranges from âˆ’1 to +1, where a high value indicates that the object is well matched to its own cluster and poorly matched to neighboring clusters. If most objects have a high value, then the clustering configuration is appropriate. If many points have a low or negative value, then the clustering configuration may have too many or too few clusters. In this implementation the silhouette is calculated with the Euclidean distance. For more information: Wikipedia Silhouette (Clustering)
